Title: Data Analyst (Beca)
Description:
Así somos:

VML es una agencia de innovación y crecimiento en un mundo en constante evolución. Contamos con un legado de un siglo de experiencia combinada, donde la creatividad se une a la tecnología para potenciar la inspiración.




Nuestra experiencia abarca todo el recorrido del cliente, ofreciendo profundos conocimientos en comunicación, comercio, consultoría, CRM, CX, datos, producción y tecnología. Proporcionamos soluciones integrales que resultan en proyectos revolucionarios.




Contamos con un equipo global de más de 30. 000 empleados en más de 150 oficinas en 64 mercados, cada uno contribuyendo a una cultura que valora la conexión, el sentido de pertenencia y el poder de las diferencias.




Este es el reto:

Buscamos a una persona que haya cursado o esté cursando alguna carrera relacionada con el análisis de datos y Big Data.




Nos ayudarás en las labores diarias en un proyecto internacional, utilizando herramientas como Phyton, SQL o Power BI.




Requisitos:

Tener disponibilidad para incorporarte el 7 de octubre.
Tener conocimientos básicos de las herramientas descritas.
Tener interés por desarrollarte en el mundo de data
Buen nivel de inglés hablado y escrito.
Poder firmar un convenio de prácticas con tu centro educativo sería genial.




La experiencia en VML:

Nuestras becas son un espacio donde hay lugar para el debate, la innovación y la transformación.
Las prácticas son remuneradas y la jornada laboral es de 25h/semana.
Nuestro modelo de trabajo es híbrido, pero se requerirá una mayor presencialidad en nuestras oficinas de Madrid.
No tenemos dress code. Ven como quieras a trabajar.




Próximos pasos:

Si has llegado hasta aquí es porque hemos conseguido llamar tu atención.😉

Apúntate a la oferta y el equipo de People echará un vistazo a tu CV. Si coincide con lo que buscamos, recibirás una llamada para conocernos mejor y que podamos contarte más sobre VML y sobre el rol.




Si necesitas un tip para el proceso: simplemente queremos que seas tú.




¿Te vienes? 🚀

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst - Contract Role in Dublin




Are you an experienced Data Analyst looking to contribute to a key project in the utilities sector? This contract offers a competitive daily rate of €415 - €515 and a hybrid work model, combining remote work with office time in Dublin. Join a 7-month programme, beginning with an initial 3-month contract, where your skills will help drive informed decisions.




Why This Role?

Competitive Pay: Daily rates from €415 to €515, valuing your expertise.
Hybrid Work: Balance working from home with time in our Dublin office.
Meaningful Work: Play a vital role in a significant project within the utilities sector.
Team Collaboration: Work with a diverse group, interacting with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




What You'll Do:

Analyse data to support business decisions.
Develop reports and dashboards using Power BI.
Run SQL queries and manage ETL processes to ensure data quality.
Communicate insights clearly to stakeholders.
Use your knowledge of the utilities sector to add context to your work.




What You Bring:

4-5 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Strong skills in Power BI and SQL, with experience in ETL processes.
Clear communication skills for working with various team members.
Experience in the utilities sector is helpful but not required.
Eligibility to work in Ireland/EU, with EU citizenship or "Stamp 4" in Ireland.




This role is suited for a skilled Data Analyst ready to make an impact within the utilities industry. If you have the required experience and are ready for a new challenge, we’d like to hear from you.

Title: Data Analyst / Analista de Datos - Energy Research
Description:
👩‍💻 Data Analyst

📍 Madrid, Spain

💰 Competitive Salary + Bonus

🏠 2 Days Working From Home




Company:

My client operates within the research function of the energy markets sector, focusing on the analysis and interpretation of market dynamics, trends, and data.




Role:

Develop analyses and convey insights to enhance clients' decision-making by actively engaging in all aspects of client projects. This includes identifying issues, forming hypotheses, conducting analyses, and synthesising conclusions into actionable recommendations.
Combine strong quantitative skills with dedication and perform effectively in team-oriented environments.




Requirements:

Strong knowledge of the Energy Market.
Experience working in the Energy sector.
The ability to gather, analyse, and interpret complex quantitative data and information.
Solid experience with Python and Excel 5.
Must have a degree in Environmental Science, Physics, Engineering, Mathematics or a related field.




What's in it for you?

Combine strong quantitative skills with dedication and performance in team-oriented environments.
Work in a dynamic and intellectually stimulating yet supportive environment.
Enjoy autonomy and the opportunity to substantially influence major decisions in the energy sector.
Grow into an industry expert.
Opportunity for progression within the company.




Next Steps:

This is a chance to be a "Go-to" for the industry, with your work and insights globally recognised.




As long as your happy working in English, and looking to drive forward in your career then please do hit apply!




Empresa:

Mi cliente opera dentro de la función de investigación del sector de mercados energéticos, enfocándose en el análisis e interpretación de las dinámicas del mercado, tendencias y datos.




Rol:

Desarrollar análisis y transmitir perspectivas para mejorar la toma de decisiones de los clientes participando activamente en todos los aspectos de los proyectos de los clientes. Esto incluye identificar problemas, formular hipótesis, realizar análisis y sintetizar conclusiones en recomendaciones accionables. Combinar habilidades cuantitativas sólidas con dedicación y desempeñarse de manera efectiva en entornos orientados al trabajo en equipo.




Requisitos:

Conocimiento sólido del mercado de energía.
Experiencia laboral en el sector energético.
Capacidad para recopilar, analizar e interpretar datos e información cuantitativa compleja.
Experiencia sólida con Python y Excel.
Debe tener un título en Ciencias Ambientales, Física, Ingeniería, Matemáticas o un campo relacionado.




¿Qué te ofrece esto?

Combina habilidades cuantitativas sólidas con dedicación y rendimiento en entornos orientados al trabajo en equipo.
Trabaja en un entorno dinámico e intelectualmente estimulante, pero a la vez de apoyo.
Disfruta de autonomía y la oportunidad de influir de manera significativa en decisiones importantes en el sector energético.
Crece como un experto en la industria.
Oportunidad de progreso dentro de la empresa.




Próximos pasos:

Esta es una oportunidad para convertirte en un referente en la industria, con tu trabajo y perspectivas reconocidos a nivel global.

Si te sientes cómodo trabajando en inglés y estás buscando avanzar en tu carrera, ¡no dudes en postularte!

Categories include:

gender
race
religion or belief
disability
age
pregnancy and maternity
marriage and civil partnership
sexual orientation
gender reassignment

Description:

Title: DATA ANALYSIS INTERN
Description:
Job Responsibilities

De'Longhi Group, one of the world’s leading players in the household appliance sector and mainly active in the coffee and food preparation segment, offers:


a multinational and stimulating environment;
exciting growth opportunities:
a strong work-life balance;


Within our Italian Commercial Subsidiary, we are looking for a talented Data Analysis Intern that will work closely with our cross-functional teams to extract, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to support key business initiatives. This role offers exposure to diverse datasets and the chance to apply statistical and analytical techniques to solve real-world business challenges. The role will play a crucial role in providing insights that drive informed decision-making in marketing, pricing, sales, trade marketing, logistics, and forecasting.

Key Responsibilities include:


Collect and clean data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Develop and implement data quality checks to maintain reliable datasets.
Perform statistical analysis on marketing, pricing, sales, trade marketing, logistics, and forecasting data.
Create insightful visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Identify trends, patterns, and outliers in the data to inform business strategies.
Explore opportunities for predictive modelling to enhance decision-making processes.


What we offer:


Internship starting in September
Duration: 6 months
Working hours: Full-time
650 euro monthly reimbursement
Free lunch canteen


Job Profile


Economics, Management or Marketing Degree (undergraduate or postgraduate);
Passion for data and numbers;
Organizational skills, flexibility, team working ability, hands-on approach;
Proficient in data analysis tools such as Python, R, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., SAP Analytics Cloud, Power BI) is a plus.
Good level of English;
Good Microsoft Excel skills;
Ability to pick up new technologies quickly and independently;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, we reject and condemn any form of discrimination including discrimination based on age, gender, sexual orientation, health, race, nationality, cultural background, political opinions and religious beliefs, and membership of associations and trade unions.
Show more
HTML:
Job Responsibilities

De'Longhi Group, one of the world’s leading players in the household appliance sector and mainly active in the coffee and food preparation segment, offers:

  • a multinational and stimulating environment;
  • exciting growth opportunities:
  • a strong work-life balance;

Within our Italian Commercial Subsidiary, we are looking for a talented Data Analysis Intern that will work closely with our cross-functional teams to extract, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to support key business initiatives. This role offers exposure to diverse datasets and the chance to apply statistical and analytical techniques to solve real-world business challenges. The role will play a crucial role in providing insights that drive informed decision-making in marketing, pricing, sales, trade marketing, logistics, and forecasting.

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Collect and clean data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
  • Develop and implement data quality checks to maintain reliable datasets.
  • Perform statistical analysis on marketing, pricing, sales, trade marketing, logistics, and forecasting data.
  • Create insightful visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and outliers in the data to inform business strategies.
  • Explore opportunities for predictive modelling to enhance decision-making processes.

What we offer:

  • Internship starting in September
  • Duration: 6 months
  • Working hours: Full-time
  • 650 euro monthly reimbursement
  • Free lunch canteen

Job Profile

  • Economics, Management or Marketing Degree (undergraduate or postgraduate);
  • Passion for data and numbers;
  • Organizational skills, flexibility, team working ability, hands-on approach;
  • Proficient in data analysis tools such as Python, R, or similar.
  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., SAP Analytics Cloud, Power BI) is a plus.
  • Good level of English;
  • Good Microsoft Excel skills;
  • Ability to pick up new technologies quickly and independently;
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, we reject and condemn any form of discrimination including discrimination based on age, gender, sexual orientation, health, race, nationality, cultural background, political opinions and religious beliefs, and membership of associations and trade unions.

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
The Company

KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics







Your role at KIKO MILANO

We are looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join KIKO MILANO’s Transformation team, reporting to the Data Analytics Senior Manager.




Such talent will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design and develop BI solutions and provide analytical support.

Your expertise will be crucial in helping the company make data-driven decisions, optimize processes, and identify growth opportunities.




In particular, you will:




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making;
Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms;
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements;
Design and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively;
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support strategic initiatives;
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and BI technologies;
Provide training and support to end-users to ensure they can effectively use BI tools and understand insights.







What you will need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data querying and manipulation.
Experience with programming languages such as Python is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.







We would love if you had

Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organisation
Strong organisational skills with an ability to re- prioritise as required to meet deadlines
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams







KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunità e dedica una particolare attenzione all’integrazione delle persone con disabilità all’interno dell’azienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99. I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. Leggi l'informativa privacy riportata al link https://static.kikocosmetics.com/public/HR/PrivacyCandidati.pdf

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My Financial Services client in Amsterdam are looking for a data analyst to join their growing team. They specialise in Mortgage advisory and are growing out their analytics capability, so are looking for an experienced profile who can help them make data-driven decisions




Responsibilities:

- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

-Perform detailed data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to insurance products, customer behavior, claims, and market conditions.

-Use statistical methods and tools to analyze large datasets and generate reports.







Requirements:

• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of PowerBI is ideal but not required

• Fluent Dutch-speaking

• Experience with stakeholder management is a plus but not required




Salary Package:

• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)




Feel free to reach out via george.rayner@vividresourcing.com

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con fuertes conocimientos en Power BI para unirse a nuestro equipo de análisis de datos donde serás responsable de transformar datos complejos en insights claros y accionables mediante la creación y optimización de informes y dashboards en Power BI.




El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




FUNCIONES

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Optimizar modelos de datos en Power BI para mejorar el rendimiento y la eficiencia de los informes, asegurando tiempos de respuesta rápidos y uso eficiente de recursos.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y estén listos para el análisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




REQUISITOS

Mínimo 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI en un entorno profesional.
Experiencia avanzada en Power BI, incluyendo la creación de informes y dashboards complejos.
Experiencia en la integración de Power BI con otras plataformas y sistemas empresariales.
Dominio de DAX para crear cálculos y medidas avanzadas.
Sólida experiencia con Power Query para la transformación y preparación de datos.
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación como SQL, Python, o R.
Valorable certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a la oficina.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
TA Job? Or a Lifetime Experience? Start Yours Here!


A nossa missão é ser uma parte significativa da carreira das nossas pessoas. À medida que crescemos, cresce também a determinação em oferecer a melhor experiência aos nossos colaboradores e clientes e é exatamente isso que nos move. Somos uma empresa portuguesa de consultoria tecnológica com escritórios em Lisboa, Porto e Óbidos e representações no Brasil, Tunísia e Índia. Contamos com mais de 11 anos de expertise no mercado, e hoje somos um universo de cerca de 400 pessoas a trabalhar em contexto presencial, remoto ou híbrido em projetos em mais de 20 países.


Acreditamos que grandes pessoas fazem empresas de sucesso e por isso mesmo defendemos a valorização, reconhecimento e crescimento dos nossos profissionais.


Não queremos ser mais uma linha do teu CV, queremos que connosco vivas uma Lifetime Experience. Apostamos em formações e certificações que confirmam a tua real progressão, na promoção de um saudável work-life balance e na oferta de benefícios com impacto na tua vida pessoal e carreira.


O que procuramos


  • Formação em Engenharia Informática ou similar;
  • Mais de 5 anos experiência em Talend;
  • Conhecimentos sólidos de SQL Server;
  • Bons conhecimentos de inglês (B2 ou superior).


Ser Affinity


  • #Affinidade – Criares relações de proximidade e empatia com colegas, clientes e candidatos (e não apenas com tecnologias, linguagens e plataformas). Espírito de equipa e boa disposição;
  • #Ambição – Quereres fazer mais e melhor. Vontade de exceder expectativas e evoluir pessoal e profissionalmente;
  • #Ação – Energia para fazer acontecer. Mostrares proatividade e capacidade de iniciativa;
  • #Aprendizagem – Vontade de evoluir individual e coletivamente e tornares-te um expert no mercado tecnológico.


A tua #LifetimeExperience


  • Participar em projetos nacionais e internacionais numa empresa baseada em relacionamentos pessoais, na simplicidade e na eficiência, com uma ação disruptiva no mercado tecnológico;
  • Aceder a um plano de carreira e formação personalizado e diretamente proporcional ao teu desempenho e interesse;
  • Fazer parte de um ambiente acolhedor, de confiança, respeito e informalidade;
  • Integrar as nossas Affinity Communities (de desporto, tecnologia, hobbies, etc.) e participar ativamente em projetos de responsabilidade social e ambiental;
  • Tirar partido de um conjunto de benefícios, parcerias, descontos eventos e dinâmicas internas.


Para além da tua satisfação profissional queremos proporcionar-te oportunidades de lazer e convívio memoráveis e dignos de uma experiência Affinity.


Join the Experience!


Envia-nos a tua candidatura e aproveita para nos conhecer e ir acompanhando em:

https://www.instagram.com/affinityportugal/

https://www.linkedin.com/company/2701281/admin/

https://twitter.com/WithAffinity

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst-Betting Company- SaaS- Hybrid- Amsterdam- 65k




My client is the premier destination for sports betting and the ultimate online (live) casino experience in the Netherlands. As pioneers in the industry, they are committed to reshaping entertainment while maintaining responsible gambling. Their goal is to create an environment where players can enjoy themselves responsibly without losing control.




An exciting opportunity awaits a Data Analyst to have a significant impact on attracting more consumers through campaigns in an Amsterdam-based online betting company. Collaborate closely with the Head of Data Analytics, who is enthusiastic about sharing knowledge with you.




In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing dashboards and data to understand where the customers are coming from and how to retain them. The IT infrastructure is state-of-the-art, utilizing all that Google has to offer, including Google Analytics, cloud resources, and data warehousing. Your responsibilities include analyzing, building, and automating new solutions.




Requirements:

3+ years of experience in data analysis (SQL & Python)
Strong analytical mindset
Good communication skills and stakeholder management
Preferably experience working in a B2C environment




Benefits

Salary up to €65k
Travel allowance
27 vacation days
Hybrid work environment
Flat organizational structure
Social drinks and lunch events




Interested? Contact me via glenn@doghouse-recruitment.nl




Unfortunately, No Visa Sponsorship / Client is not IND registered yet

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities



Translate business needs to technical specifications.
Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
Build Insights reports weekly.
Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns



About You



Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
Industry experience is a must
Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) – the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.



At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI—managed by the industry’s best and most diverse digital talent—to help the world’s trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave™: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek’s first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.


Show more
HTML:
About The Role

We are looking for a Social Media Data Analyst to create and manage insights and analytics solutions that turn data into powerful insights. In this role, you should have a background in data and business analysis. You should be analytical and an excellent communicator. If you also have business acumen and problem-solving aptitude, we’d like to meet you. Ultimately, you will enhance our business intelligence system to help us make better decisions.

Responsibilities


  • Translate business needs to technical specifications.
  • Marketing analytics partner to feed the marketing team with insights from their own social accounts and social listening.
  • Ability to work with large volumes of data and find the story in the metrics, create and communicate insights by analysing data from a variety of sources, both quantitative and qualitative;
  • Build Insights reports weekly.
  • Collaborate with local and external multicultural teams to integrate strategic and creative processes.
  • Work closely with direct external suppliers, third-party vendors, agencies, and relevant external networks.
  • Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses.
  • Create visualisations and reports for requested projects
  • Analyse big data to discover trends and patterns


About You


  • Experience working in Digital and Social Media (Social Listening or Business Intelligence)
  • Strong knowledge of how Social Media platforms work (Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Instagram, YouTube)
  • Strong knowledge of Social Media Listening Tools (such as Sprinklr, Brandwatch, Talkwalker, etc will be considered an extra)
  • Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must
  • Industry experience is a must
  • Excellent organisational, interpersonal, and communication skills (both written and verbal).
  • Understanding of Branding, Marketing, and Research Communication;
  • Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
  • Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
  • Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
  • Proficiency in English. (Spanish will be considered an extra)
  • Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Knowledge of using programming languages (such as VBA macros, python, javascript) to automate analysis and reporting processes will be highly valued
  • Fluency with visualisation tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) – the ability to create interactive, user-friendly, and compelling dashboards and reports.


At .Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI—managed by the industry’s best and most diverse digital talent—to help the world’s trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave™: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek’s first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHO WE ARE?

NOEWE group — one of the major professional service providers in the Lithuanian market — offers a portfolio of services in financial planning, legal, tax, business consulting, accounting services, as well as asset and wealth management.




Being a part of the NOEWE group, Management Consulting team offer one-stop-shop services in strategic assistance, and the solutions required for the implementation of these strategies. Every situation is unique. Our task is to understand client's challenges, or in some cases to leverage our experience in order to identify them. And because we are not bound by any conflicts of interest (as global professional service networks are) we always openly share our strategic vision, bold insights and solutions.




📢 We are looking forward to welcome a new Management Consulting team member - Data Analyst to work from our office in Vilnius!




JOIN US IF YOU:

Are smart, result-driven, and have a strong analytical mindset
Have a background in data analysis and statistical methods
Have experience in data visualization and creating insightful reports
Can identify trends, patterns, and insights from complex data sets
Want to help our clients by analyzing data, providing insights, and supporting data-driven decision-making
Are fluent in English and Lithuanian languages




IDEALLY YOU HAVE:

University degree in Data Science, Information Technology​​, Mathematics, Economics or similar
Are proficient in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R, Tableau)
​1-2 years of relevant work experience




OUR INPUT FOR YOUR WELLBEING:

Interesting and diverse experience in the field of management consulting – challenging projects across many different functional areas and industries​
​Continuous learning, personal and professional development​
​Opportunity to work with top managers and key decision makers​
​Opportunity to join forces and become a part of a team of experts​
​Friendly, supportive, and exceptional working environment (fresh & new “D9-Artsy office“)​
​Personalized motivational system (referral bonuses, sick days, additional vacation days, budget for professional training and development, health insurance, etc.)​
​Remote work possibility




SALARY 1650-2200 EUR Gross per month




Confidentiality guaranteed. Only selected candidates will be contacted.

When you apply to a job (and / or internship) position, you agree, that the personal data contained in your application (CV) will be processed by Noewe. Your personal data will be processed for the purposes of managing recruitment related activities and will be stored for a period of 3 years in order to contact you about future job / internship opportunities in Lewben group. If you want to withdraw your consent for using your above-mentioned data, please inform us via E-mail: privacy@noewe.eu. For more information how we will process your data and about your rights, please see our policy available at https://noewe.eu/legal-information/privacy-policy/.

Title: Junior Financial Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London

• Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training

• Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit

• An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Analyze client portfolios consisting of leveraged loans and HY bonds

• Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings

• Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems

• Work closely with the securitized products structuring team on new issue securitization transactions

• Conduct market and asset level research




You have:




• BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)

• 0-2 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm

• Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)

• Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset

• Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English




Team profile




Morgan Stanley FID Deleveraging and Lending group (“DLG”) provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.

The Securitized Products Structuring team builds financial models to help issuers and investors optimize transaction economics and quantify sources of value and risk. The team is present both in the primary and secondary markets of these products and interacts with its counterparties in New York and London continuously.




About Morgan Stanley




Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.

At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We never ask for payment as part of our selection process, and we always contact candidates via our corporate accounts and platforms. If you are approached for payment, this is likely to be fraudulent. Please check to see whether the role you are interested in is posted here, on our website.




Role profile

Purpose of the role

The purpose of this role is to analyze large datasets from various digital platforms utilized within TMF Digital Operations. The goal is to distill these datasets into valuable insights, empowering stakeholders to leverage this intelligence for strategizing and executing the next best action.




Key Functions and Responsibilities

Understanding Business processes and existing ecosystem
Understand Business KPIs, metrics and their calculations
Analyze, understand, and model data being used in the process
Perform Descriptive and Diagnostic analysis on datasets
Identify key insights, relations from data in the context of the Business scenario
Share analysis with Business users
Work collaboratively with Business users and others in team to deliver insights in an agile manner
Ownership of data quality and identification of potential enhancements
Ensure process compliance




Competencies and Skills

The technical skills required for this role are good understanding of database principles and SQL. Ability to support conclusions with analytical evidence using descriptive and inferential statistics. Knowledge of tools like Alteryx will be an added advantage.

Soft skills required include analytical mindset, problem solving ability, excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to work in a collaborative environment.




Experience and Qualifications

Have a passion for data analysis and drawing insights from data
Has a strong problem solving and analytical mindset
Ability to interpret & ask questions to understand business requirements, to ensure successful business outcomes
Motivation to understand business processes and data platforms to design/deliver scalable data solutions to support customer needs
Good understanding of database principles and SQL, to perform complex analysis
Ensure the consistency and quality of data solutions completed by the engineering team
Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly & intuitively
Ability to follow instructions and work in a team environment, adapting to situation & need
Ability to operate using Agile Methodology and DevOps tools, to coordinate, deliver & track work
Can work independently under limited supervision & apply subject knowledge in Data Analysis
Self-motivated and able to proactively learn good practice through research, peer Q&A & experiments
Appreciation of business case fundamentals an advantage, to contribute throughout solution lifecycle
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively advocate solutions to engineering teams and business stakeholders
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment
Able to support conclusions with analytical evidence using descriptive stats and inferential stats

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math or a similar area;
  • Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools (for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.);
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/Data_Analyst”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Catch the Goodhabitz sparkle

Welcome to GoodHabitz, one of the fastest-growing international Ed-Tech companies in Europe. Our mission? To make learning as accessible, engaging, and fun as binge-watching your favorite series, scrolling through your news feed, or watching your team score a winning goal. How do we do it? We craft unique training experiences now available in 20 countries worldwide, all produced in-house at the GoodHabitz Studios. But we're not all work and no play. We invest in fun outings and events, ensuring our team has the time of their lives.

Behind the scenes, we're a team of goal-driven individuals who thrive on mutual inspiration and support. We're positive, creative masterminds always looking on the bright side, eager to tackle every challenge that comes our way.

The challenge

Welcome to the world of data insights at our dynamic organization! As a Product Data Analyst, you're not just crunching numbers; you're steering the ship by deciphering the intricate details of our product. Armed with strong statistical and mathematical skills, you'll be translating complex data into clear, actionable insights.Ready to dive into the heart of strategic decision-making? Let's break down your journey:

What You'll Do 🎯


Data Discovery: Dive into colossal datasets, unraveling the magic behind our SaaS product metrics. Create dashboards that tell tales of user behavior and product performance. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to drive product strategy and decision-making.
Data Guardian: Your mission? Ensure the harmony of information from our platform data and CRM data, and every nook and cranny. You're not just a data guardian; you're the one setting the standards, making data integrity a company-wide anthem
Teamwork Trailblazer: In your journey, you're not alone. Engage with Product Managers, Designers and Developers. Be the storyteller, presenting insights that resonate with data aficionados and rookies alike
Continuous Thrills: Being a perfection seeker, you'll spot areas for improvement. Recommendations based on data revelations? That's your specialty. Stay ahead of the curve with the coolest data tools and industry best practices



Requirements

This role is a perfect match for you because ...


Your Toolkit: Hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or a related field. It's your academic armor!
Statistical Brain: While inferring any analysis your go to techniques are statistical models such as linear regressions, classification models etc. Explaining the relevance of your analysis to non technical stakeholders is natural to you
SQL Sorcery: Speak the language of data with proficiency in SQL. Tableau is your go-to Business Intelligence tool for day to day analytics.
Analytical Jedi Skills: Your analytical lightsaber is sharp, coupled with critical thinking and problem-solving prowess. You have a good understanding of Google Analytics.
Experience Expedition: Navigate the data landscape with at least three years of data analysis experience in a product environment, preferably in the SaaS realm. You've got a trail of insights behind you.
Communication Charisma: Your ability to narrate the data story is unparalleled. Excellent communication and presentation skills are your secret weapons
Language Proficiency: Fluency in English. You speak the global language of insights. Bonus points if you are acquainted with Dutch
Solo Explorer and Team Trailblazer: Whether wandering the data wilderness alone or part of a cross-functional team, you're a force to be reckoned with



Benefits

Join us, and you'll become a valued part of a lively and dynamic team. We nurture a flexible and supportive work culture that strikes the perfect balance between your professional life and your well-deserved downtime. Step into our magical office space (yes, it even features a campfire!), fully equipped with all the tools and resources to empower you. Prepare for unforgettable team-building experiences and company events that will leave you inspired. And, of course, we've got your back with complimentary coffee and snacks to keep you energized.

Here's a Glimpse Of What's Waiting For You


A competitive salary package that rewards your hard work
25 paid vacation days. And if that's not enough, you can add up to 10 more
A world of growth and development opportunities to enhance your skills. You'll have unlimited access to our treasure trove of GoodHabitz resources and MyAcademy
Access to mental coaching through our partner, OpenUp, to keep your mind in top shape
An annual do-good-day, fully paid, so you can contribute to a cause you're passionate about
Travel and expense reimbursement because we've got your journey covered
Pension and disability insurance, securing your financial well-being in the long run
A hybrid way of working
A work from anywhere policy after your first year;
Working in a company that welcomes artificial intelligence and uses it to improve internal processes and push AI-powered features quickly
No non-technical managers! Have a manager who gets it, who inspires and leads the way as a champion for engineering excellence
MacBook Pro


Ready to take the next step in your career and join a team that's as vibrant as it is supportive? We can't wait to have you on board!
Show more

  • Access to mental coaching through our partner, OpenUp, to keep your mind in top shape
  • An annual do-good-day, fully paid, so you can contribute to a cause you're passionate about
  • Travel and expense reimbursement because we've got your journey covered
  • Pension and disability insurance, securing your financial well-being in the long run
  • A hybrid way of working
  • A work from anywhere policy after your first year;
  • Working in a company that welcomes artificial intelligence and uses it to improve internal processes and push AI-powered features quickly
  • No non-technical managers! Have a manager who gets it, who inspires and leads the way as a champion for engineering excellence
  • MacBook Pro

Ready to take the next step in your career and join a team that's as vibrant as it is supportive? We can't wait to have you on board!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
REQUIREMENTS




Over 3 years of work experience in similar position
Bachelor's degree in business administration, economics or engineering.
Excellent spoken and written English.
Strong analytical skills, ability to discover requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches while working with unstructured datasets.
Ability to handle multiple projects areas with changing priorities and meet challenging deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Good understanding of data warehousing, data modeling, database design, business intelligence and their processes
Hands on knowledge about financial systems would be a plus
Experience with, database and reporting tools (SQL and Power BI)
Experience in working with Agile methodology is an advantage
Experience in BPMS and Modeling Workflow automation projects is an advantage




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES




Acts as a SPOC for internal and external parties involved in the project in different stages of the software development process, such as presales presentations, gathering requirements, solution design, functional and user acceptance testing.
Assesses the current state of the business and IT landscape to identify gaps, transition and integration requirements, recommends improvements and define the acceptance criteria.
Focus on implementing analytical requirements.
Communicate with precision: Crafts high quality and detailed diagrams, reports and presentations as needed.
Collaborate with data modelers, architects, developers and source system analysts to define source system output files structure, ensuring the quality of the data and considering non functional requirements (security, performance, availability or scalability
Create requirements mappings for the business terms defined by the business stakeholders and source to target mappings for the logical & physical model defined by the data modelers.
Elaborates features and transform them into stories for the implementation backlog in order to enable the team to implement solutions that will meet the business stakeholders’ needs
Work closely with developers, testers, product owner, delivery manager, in order to ensure the team keeps the product vision and priorities in mind.
Participate in handover, end user training and deployment activities.
Provides consulting and technical support to the end users
Ensure that workflow and internal (IT) procedures are applied within the business process and it is compliance with external and internal regulations and procedures
Show more
HTML:
REQUIREMENTS


  • Over 3 years of work experience in similar position
  • Bachelor's degree in business administration, economics or engineering.
  • Excellent spoken and written English.
  • Strong analytical skills, ability to discover requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches while working with unstructured datasets.
  • Ability to handle multiple projects areas with changing priorities and meet challenging deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Good understanding of data warehousing, data modeling, database design, business intelligence and their processes
  • Hands on knowledge about financial systems would be a plus
  • Experience with, database and reporting tools (SQL and Power BI)
  • Experience in working with Agile methodology is an advantage
  • Experience in BPMS and Modeling Workflow automation projects is an advantage


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Acts as a SPOC for internal and external parties involved in the project in different stages of the software development process, such as presales presentations, gathering requirements, solution design, functional and user acceptance testing.
  • Assesses the current state of the business and IT landscape to identify gaps, transition and integration requirements, recommends improvements and define the acceptance criteria.
  • Focus on implementing analytical requirements.
  • Communicate with precision: Crafts high quality and detailed diagrams, reports and presentations as needed.
  • Collaborate with data modelers, architects, developers and source system analysts to define source system output files structure, ensuring the quality of the data and considering non functional requirements (security, performance, availability or scalability
  • Create requirements mappings for the business terms defined by the business stakeholders and source to target mappings for the logical & physical model defined by the data modelers.
  • Elaborates features and transform them into stories for the implementation backlog in order to enable the team to implement solutions that will meet the business stakeholders’ needs
  • Work closely with developers, testers, product owner, delivery manager, in order to ensure the team keeps the product vision and priorities in mind.
  • Participate in handover, end user training and deployment activities.
  • Provides consulting and technical support to the end users
  • Ensure that workflow and internal (IT) procedures are applied within the business process and it is compliance with external and internal regulations and procedures

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Adecco Italia Spa, ricerca per azienda operante nel settore della produzione di energia elettrica da fonte rinnovabile e tradizionale, una risorsa da inserire nell'ambito dell’Energy Management.




Ruolo: Data Analyst Junior




Descrizione delle attività:

Analisi, raccoglimento e interpretazione dati;
Stretta collaborazione con responsabili dei diversi dipartimenti aziendali;
Elaborazione report dettagliati con i risultati delle osservazioni effettuate;
Individuazione soluzioni concrete a partire dai risultati delle analisi.




Requisiti:

Conoscenza linguaggio di programmazione R e gestionale Python;
Ottima conoscenza di Excel;
Eccellenti doti di analisi anche di documenti regolatori e normativi complessi e di sintesi;
Titolo preferenziale la conoscenza dei mercati energetici (gas e elettrico).







Completano il profilo:

Problem solving

Capacità di gestione dello stress




Sede di lavoro: Civitavecchia

Modalità di lavoro: in sede, si prevedono due turni.

Tipologia contratto: inserimento diretto in azienda, retribuzione da definire coerentemente con le competenze della persona.




I candidati, nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006, D.lgs 215/2003 e D.lgs 216/2003, sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy consultabile sotto il form di richiesta dati della pagina di candidatura (Regolamento UE n. 2016/679).




ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa sulla pagina dedicata al phishing su adecco.it.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
📢 🔎 Desde ACCOM, empresa de Marketing Digital orientada en ventas, buscamos nuevo/a compi como Data Analyst con manejo de POWER BI y conocimiento en PYTHON, para que se incorpore a nuestro Equipo de Data & BI!




💡 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Dominio en manejo de herramientas de visualización (PowerBI).
Conocimientos en SQL avanzado, desarrollo, gestión y rendimiento.
Experiencia en infraestructura de Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Conocimiento en Python.
Habilidades en analítica de datos orientado a resultados de negocio.
Grado en Estadística, Física, Matemáticas, Economía, Ingeniería Informática o similares.




📝 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los equipos de negocio para comprender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en requisitos técnicos y visualizaciones efectivas.
Diseñar, crear y mantener flujos, informes y paneles de Power BI
Proporcionar soporte y capacitación en el uso de Power BI a los usuarios, ayudándoles a aprovechar al máximo la herramienta.
Analizar y optimizar el rendimiento de consultas SQL.
Trabajar en mapeo de datos, flujo de datos y linaje de datos.
Realizar análisis y evaluaciones de datos para identificar áreas de mejora, oportunidades de crecimiento y eficiencias operativas.




📌 ¿Qué ofrecemos?




Accom es una empresa de carácter joven y competitivo en constante crecimiento. Cuidamos mucho nuestra política de Talento y Cultura, buscando siempre la máxima vinculación de las personas con la empresa. Simplemente tratamos a las personas como nos gustaría que nos tratasen.




📈 Participación en la toma de decisiones.
📅 Flexibilidad horaria.
💻 Posibilidad de teletrabajo en formato híbrido.
💳 Retribución flexible (seguro médico privado, restaurante, transporte y guardería).
📚 Plan formativo acorde a tus necesidades.
💼 Cursos de idiomas ajustados a tu nivel.
🍰 El día de tu cumpleaños libre.
🤼 Eventos y actividades internas para hacer team building.
🏋🏻‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios.
📍 Ubicaciones céntricas en Madrid (Callao).




¡Si crees que eres el perfil que buscamos, estaremos encantados de conocerte!

Title: Data analyst Power BI - Débutant H/F
Description:
Profil du candidat

Vous avez récemment été diplômé(e) d'un Bac + 5 ?

Au cours de votre parcours, vous avez acquis des connaissances et compétences dans les domaines de la finance et du commerce ?

Débutez votre carrière par une expérience stimulante au cœur d’équipes internationales, engagées dans la transition énergétique !

Nous recherchons pour une durée de 12 mois sur notre site Coupole (92), un.e Data analyst Power BI - Débutant H/F

Les compétences attendues sont les suivantes :

Compétences techniques :


Power Bi, SAP, Esbase
Connaissances en contrôle de gestion



Savoir être indispensables :


Rigueur
Méthode
Capacité d'analyse
Curieux



Nous vous proposons un contrat de professionnalisation temps plein qualifiant de 12 mois incluant 15% de formation interne (métier, linguistique, outils…). Ces formations sont dispensées en interne par des organismes sélectionnés par TotalEnergies.

Ce contrat vous permettra d’acquérir une année d’expérience professionnelle tout en étant formé aux spécificités de votre métier en lien avec les activités de la Compagnie.

Pour postuler à cette offre, vous devez impérativement posséder, à la date d’embauche, un titre de séjour valide pour la période couverte par cette offre (minimum 13 mois). Attention, la conclusion de ce contrat de professionnalisation ne permet pas la délivrance d’un titre de séjour (article R.52221-6 du Code du travail).

Ce poste ne s'adresse pas aux personnes recherchant une alternance avec une école ou une formation diplômante, mais aux personnes récemment diplômées à la recherche d'une première expérience.

Un réel atout pour booster votre employabilité !

Activités

En tant que Data analyst Power BI - Débutant H/F, vos missions seront les suivantes :


Fiabiliser/stabiliser certains rapports Power Bi existants
Comprendre les besoins du contrôle de gestion et des opérationnels en matière de reporting financier et proposer des améliorations.
Créer des tableaux de bord interactifs pour présenter les résultats de manière graphique et concises aux opérationnels.
Préconiser des solutions techniques adaptées , concevoir et développer des solutions Power BI
Accompagner les clients dans l'acculturation de Power BI
Former les utilisateurs sur les nouveaux outils de reporting sur Power BI
Gérer la documentation technique, documenter la modélisation et le fonctionnement des rapports



Si cette offre vous intéresse alors n'attendez plus... Postulez chez TotalEnergies !

Contexte et environnement

Fonction au sein de la direction Contrôle de Gestion Siège de la Direction Finance - Economie - Réserves pétrolières de la branche Exploration Production.

Vous évoluerez au sein d'une équipe de 12 personnes dans le service Cost Control Siège:


Effectifs gérés: 530- Dépenses : 344 M€ - Refacturation aux filiales: 126 M€



Contexte international important, toutes les filiales sont à l'étranger et de nombreux collègues ou contacts sont étrangers
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For over a decade, the Bosch Cluj Plant has become a strategic hub for innovation and production, making a significant impact on the technological landscape in Romania. Through our constant commitment to excellence in quality and innovation, we develop a diverse range of modern products for the mobility industry, focusing on delivering cutting-edge solutions to our international customers. Inspired by passion for technology, we have consistently evolved, solidifying our position as the most desired employer in Cluj for the engineering and business candidates. We pay special attention to the development of our community, inspiring future generations and governing our impact on the environment.

Our promise to our colleagues is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and inspire each other. Join us and see the difference. Work



Job Description



Are you driven to unlock the power of data and translate it into strategic insights? Are you passionate about digital transformation? Our cutting-edge manufacturing plant is searching for a data whiz to join our team! As we embrace Industry 4.0 and become a data-driven powerhouse, you'll play a key role in crafting informative reports and dashboards using Tableau and PowerBI. We need someone who will understand our business inside and out, and can design and implement BI solutions that fuel smart decision-making. You'll be a data maestro, wrangling information from various sources like our ERP (SAP), MES, and data warehouse to paint a clear picture through KPIs.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable and insightful BI reports and dashboards using Tableau, PowerBI, and other relevant BI tools.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and define data requirements that align with business goals, ensuring accurate representation of data in BI reports.
Understand and analyze data from our ERP (SAP), MES, and various local solutions, integrating them effectively to provide comprehensive insights.
Continuously enhance data collection methods to improve efficiency and accuracy, supporting the creation of a robust data warehouse for KPI reporting.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, providing actionable insights to stakeholders.
Leverage low code / no code technologies to streamline data analytics processes and develop rapid prototypes of data solutions.
Implement low code / no code applications to enhance the flexibility and responsiveness of BI solutions to changing business needs.
Facilitate training and support for users of BI tools across the organization, fostering a data-driven culture.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst, with extensive experience in designing and implementing BI solutions.
Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau and PowerBI is essential.
Strong understanding of ERP systems, preferably SAP, MES, and data warehouse technologies.
Proficient in SQL and experience in querying databases, data manipulation, and analysis.
Familiarity with low code / no code platforms and their application in data analytics projects.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong communication skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently.
Proactive, curious, and innovative, with a strong problem-solving aptitude.


Additional Information



Bosch Benefits

25 days of annual leave – because your work-life balance is essential to us
Annual performance bonus up to two salaries – we appreciate your contribution to the company’s success
Annual salary review – we want you to feel fairly compensated for your hard work and dedication
Gift tickets worth 300 RON for Christmas and Easter
Flexible benefits – you will benefit from a monthly benefit budget that offers the possibility to customize the benefits package to suit your individual needs and preferences (You can opt for meal tickets worth 30 RON for every worked day or you can benefit from cultural tickets, gift tickets, or vacation vouchers, and discounts at restaurants, dentistry, shops, and many more)
Referral bonus - we encourage you to refer new candidates and you will be rewarded for it
Relocation package – we are committed to providing a supportive and inclusive work environment, so if you are recruited from another county, you will receive a special relocation bonus for 2 years which will help you to get settled in Cluj
Lunch discount – we have two canteens within our plant where you can eat your lunch at subsidized price
Flexible working hours – so that you can balance you work and personal obligations more effectively
Ability to work from the satellite Bosch location in Cluj-Napoca when it’s more convenient for you to do so
Home Office policy – you will benefit from a hybrid working model which takes into consideration the needs of each department in the plant and offers you the possibility to work from home when it is practical and convenient for you
Private medical insurance because health is a priority to us
Development Trainings - we have our own team of dedicated trainers that are providing specific trainings for personal and professional growth. In addition to this, we provide local development programs for Project Managers, Line Managers and Experts, external trainings, and assignments opportunities
Language courses – if your role demands it, you will have the chance to enhance your language skill set internally
Inspiring working conditions – we are committed to providing our employees a positive and fulfilling work experience
Transportation - to and from the Bosch Cluj Plant
Show more

  • Language courses – if your role demands it, you will have the chance to enhance your language skill set internally
  • Inspiring working conditions – we are committed to providing our employees a positive and fulfilling work experience
  • Transportation - to and from the Bosch Cluj Plant

Title: DATA ANALYSIS INTERN
Description:
Job Responsibilities

De'Longhi Group, one of the world’s leading players in the household appliance sector and mainly active in the coffee and food preparation segment, offers:


a multinational and stimulating environment;
exciting growth opportunities:
a strong work-life balance;


Within our Italian Commercial Subsidiary, we are looking for a talented Data Analysis Intern that will work closely with our cross-functional teams to extract, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to support key business initiatives. This role offers exposure to diverse datasets and the chance to apply statistical and analytical techniques to solve real-world business challenges. The role will play a crucial role in providing insights that drive informed decision-making in marketing, pricing, sales, trade marketing, logistics, and forecasting.

Key Responsibilities include:


Collect and clean data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Develop and implement data quality checks to maintain reliable datasets.
Perform statistical analysis on marketing, pricing, sales, trade marketing, logistics, and forecasting data.
Create insightful visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Identify trends, patterns, and outliers in the data to inform business strategies.
Explore opportunities for predictive modelling to enhance decision-making processes.


What we offer:


Internship starting in September
Duration: 6 months
Working hours: Full-time
650 euro monthly reimbursement
Free lunch canteen


Job Profile


Economics, Management or Marketing Degree (undergraduate or postgraduate);
Passion for data and numbers;
Organizational skills, flexibility, team working ability, hands-on approach;
Proficient in data analysis tools such as Python, R, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., SAP Analytics Cloud, Power BI) is a plus.
Good level of English;
Good Microsoft Excel skills;
Ability to pick up new technologies quickly and independently;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, we reject and condemn any form of discrimination including discrimination based on age, gender, sexual orientation, health, race, nationality, cultural background, political opinions and religious beliefs, and membership of associations and trade unions.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

  • Strong spoken and written English

Title: Data Analyst Working Student
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

We are currently recruiting a Working Student Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Your focus will be on leveraging our technology stack to derive insights and support various teams within the business.

What You Will Do


Utilize tools like Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, Tableau, and Superset to analyse data from our group data warehouse
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and insights
Develop visualizations and storytelling to communicate complex data analysis in an understandable manner
Understand and apply core e-commerce KPIs in your analysis
Utilize your analytical and problem-solving skills to identify trends and insights



What You Should Bring


Currently enrolled in a degree in business, mathematics, science, or engineering
Experience in writing and reviewing SQL queries
Proficiency in building visualizations and data storytelling
Understanding of core e-commerce KPIs
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/
