Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Availability to travel Middle East (25% of the time/Year)*




Who are we:




Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.

Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join one of our largest international partners in the Telecommunications sector. It is one of the biggest references in the area, with a significant presence in more than 6 countries.




What you will do:




Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.




As a part of your job, you will:

Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.




What you are like:




Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.




Why join us:




• Work on challenging projects for big clients

• Learn more about emerging technologies

• Possibility of working remotely

• Design your career plan

• Access to continuous training and certifications

• Evolve through our internal mobility program

• … and much more!

Show more

Title: Data & BI Analyst
Description:
The Company

KIKO MILANO was founded in 1997 in Milan and since then has revolutionized how cosmetics are sold globally. We thrive to offer an incredible variety of products, textures & colours, a multi-sensorial experience in innovative technology yet always at an affordable price. Based in Italy, and truthful to its DNA, KIKO MILANO takes advantage of combining trustworthy quality, creativity and stunning aesthetics







Your role at KIKO MILANO

We are looking for a Data & BI Analyst to join KIKO MILANO’s Transformation team, reporting to the Data Analytics Senior Manager.




Such talent will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design and develop BI solutions and provide analytical support.

Your expertise will be crucial in helping the company make data-driven decisions, optimize processes, and identify growth opportunities.




In particular, you will:




Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making;
Develop, implement, and maintain BI solutions using tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms;
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into technical requirements;
Design and create dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings effectively;
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to answer specific business questions and support strategic initiatives;
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analytics and BI technologies;
Provide training and support to end-users to ensure they can effectively use BI tools and understand insights.







What you will need to succeed

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, Business Analytics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related role.
Proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, QlikView, or similar.
Strong SQL skills and experience with data querying and manipulation.
Experience with programming languages such as Python is a plus.
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud is a plus.







We would love if you had

Excellent communication and influencing skills with experience of building relationships across an organisation
Strong organisational skills with an ability to re- prioritise as required to meet deadlines
Experience working in a fast-paced environment
Highly collaborative style and willingness and demonstrated ability to work in teams







KIKO si impegna ad ampliare i propri sforzi per garantire le Pari Opportunità e dedica una particolare attenzione all’integrazione delle persone con disabilità all’interno dell’azienda. Tutte le posizioni aperte in KIKO sono rivolte anche ai candidati appartenenti alle Categorie Protette l.68/99. I dati verranno trattati esclusivamente ai fini di Ricerca del Personale. Leggi l'informativa privacy riportata al link https://static.kikocosmetics.com/public/HR/PrivacyCandidati.pdf

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My Financial Services client in Amsterdam are looking for a data analyst to join their growing team. They specialise in Mortgage advisory and are growing out their analytics capability, so are looking for an experienced profile who can help them make data-driven decisions




Responsibilities:

- Collecting and interpreting data from multiple sources, both internal and external.

- Cleaning and validating data to ensure accuracy, completeness, and reliability.

- Analyzing complex datasets using statistical methods and data visualization tools.

- Developing and maintaining databases, data systems, and dashboards for reporting purposes.

- Identifying trends, patterns, and correlations in data sets to support business objectives.

- Creating comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

-Perform detailed data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights related to insurance products, customer behavior, claims, and market conditions.

-Use statistical methods and tools to analyze large datasets and generate reports.







Requirements:

• Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (data science, computer science, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

• Strong SQL skills

• Knowledge of PowerBI is ideal but not required

• Fluent Dutch-speaking

• Experience with stakeholder management is a plus but not required




Salary Package:

• Up to €75,000 per annum (D.O.E)

• Travel allowance

• Hybrid working and flexible working hours

• Annual bonus. (depending on the company performance)




Feel free to reach out via george.rayner@vividresourcing.com

Title: Data Analyst Power BI
Description:
En Logicalis Spain estamos buscando un perfil de Analista de Datos con fuertes conocimientos en Power BI para unirse a nuestro equipo de análisis de datos donde serás responsable de transformar datos complejos en insights claros y accionables mediante la creación y optimización de informes y dashboards en Power BI.




El equipo de Data & Analytics de Logicalis trabaja con clientes nacionales e internacionales, llevando a cabo importantes proyectos de inteligencia artificial y analítica avanzada, estrategia del dato, gobierno, integración y arquitectura, abarcando todo el ciclo de vida del dato.




FUNCIONES

Diseñar, desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards interactivos en Power BI que proporcionen insights clave para diferentes áreas de la empresa.
Optimizar modelos de datos en Power BI para mejorar el rendimiento y la eficiencia de los informes, asegurando tiempos de respuesta rápidos y uso eficiente de recursos.
Crear y mantener medidas y cálculos complejos utilizando DAX para proporcionar análisis avanzados y personalizados.
Utilizar Power Query para transformar y preparar datos provenientes de múltiples fuentes, asegurando que los datos sean precisos y estén listos para el análisis.
Crear visualizaciones de datos efectivas y persuasivas que comuniquen insights de manera clara y concisa.
Asegurar que los informes y dashboards estén actualizados y reflejen los datos más recientes, implementando actualizaciones y mejoras continuas.




REQUISITOS

Mínimo 2 años de experiencia trabajando con Power BI en un entorno profesional.
Experiencia avanzada en Power BI, incluyendo la creación de informes y dashboards complejos.
Experiencia en la integración de Power BI con otras plataformas y sistemas empresariales.
Dominio de DAX para crear cálculos y medidas avanzadas.
Sólida experiencia con Power Query para la transformación y preparación de datos.
Conocimientos en lenguajes de programación como SQL, Python, o R.
Valorable certificaciones en Power BI o análisis de datos.




BENEFICIOS

> Incorporación inmediata a compañía líder del sector IT con un alto grado de expertise en el área de Data & Analytics dónde nos encontramos en pleno proceso de expansión.

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a la oficina.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Show more

> Estabilidad laboral a través de contrato indefinido con amplias oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y crecimiento en la compañía.

> Modalidad de trabajo 100% remoto con flexibilidad para ir puntualmente a la oficina.

> Paquete retributivo muy competitivo acorde a la valía del candidato.

> Posibilidad de acogerse a planes de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte y tarjeta guardería).

> Seguro médico y GYMPASS.

> Planes de formación adaptados a cada perfil (cursos técnicos, certificaciones oficiales, formación de idiomas...).

> Portal de descuentos especiales para empleados.

> Buen ambiente de trabajo y entorno muy colaborativo.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Catch the Goodhabitz sparkle

Welcome to GoodHabitz, one of the fastest-growing international Ed-Tech companies in Europe. Our mission? To make learning as accessible, engaging, and fun as binge-watching your favorite series, scrolling through your news feed, or watching your team score a winning goal. How do we do it? We craft unique training experiences now available in 20 countries worldwide, all produced in-house at the GoodHabitz Studios. But we're not all work and no play. We invest in fun outings and events, ensuring our team has the time of their lives.

Behind the scenes, we're a team of goal-driven individuals who thrive on mutual inspiration and support. We're positive, creative masterminds always looking on the bright side, eager to tackle every challenge that comes our way.

The challenge

Welcome to the world of data insights at our dynamic organization! As a Product Data Analyst, you're not just crunching numbers; you're steering the ship by deciphering the intricate details of our product. Armed with strong statistical and mathematical skills, you'll be translating complex data into clear, actionable insights.Ready to dive into the heart of strategic decision-making? Let's break down your journey:

What You'll Do 🎯


Data Discovery: Dive into colossal datasets, unraveling the magic behind our SaaS product metrics. Create dashboards that tell tales of user behavior and product performance. Provide actionable insights and recommendations to drive product strategy and decision-making.
Data Guardian: Your mission? Ensure the harmony of information from our platform data and CRM data, and every nook and cranny. You're not just a data guardian; you're the one setting the standards, making data integrity a company-wide anthem
Teamwork Trailblazer: In your journey, you're not alone. Engage with Product Managers, Designers and Developers. Be the storyteller, presenting insights that resonate with data aficionados and rookies alike
Continuous Thrills: Being a perfection seeker, you'll spot areas for improvement. Recommendations based on data revelations? That's your specialty. Stay ahead of the curve with the coolest data tools and industry best practices



Requirements

This role is a perfect match for you because ...


Your Toolkit: Hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, or a related field. It's your academic armor!
Statistical Brain: While inferring any analysis your go to techniques are statistical models such as linear regressions, classification models etc. Explaining the relevance of your analysis to non technical stakeholders is natural to you
SQL Sorcery: Speak the language of data with proficiency in SQL. Tableau is your go-to Business Intelligence tool for day to day analytics.
Analytical Jedi Skills: Your analytical lightsaber is sharp, coupled with critical thinking and problem-solving prowess. You have a good understanding of Google Analytics.
Experience Expedition: Navigate the data landscape with at least three years of data analysis experience in a product environment, preferably in the SaaS realm. You've got a trail of insights behind you.
Communication Charisma: Your ability to narrate the data story is unparalleled. Excellent communication and presentation skills are your secret weapons
Language Proficiency: Fluency in English. You speak the global language of insights. Bonus points if you are acquainted with Dutch
Solo Explorer and Team Trailblazer: Whether wandering the data wilderness alone or part of a cross-functional team, you're a force to be reckoned with



Benefits

Join us, and you'll become a valued part of a lively and dynamic team. We nurture a flexible and supportive work culture that strikes the perfect balance between your professional life and your well-deserved downtime. Step into our magical office space (yes, it even features a campfire!), fully equipped with all the tools and resources to empower you. Prepare for unforgettable team-building experiences and company events that will leave you inspired. And, of course, we've got your back with complimentary coffee and snacks to keep you energized.

Here's a Glimpse Of What's Waiting For You


A competitive salary package that rewards your hard work
25 paid vacation days. And if that's not enough, you can add up to 10 more
A world of growth and development opportunities to enhance your skills. You'll have unlimited access to our treasure trove of GoodHabitz resources and MyAcademy
Access to mental coaching through our partner, OpenUp, to keep your mind in top shape
An annual do-good-day, fully paid, so you can contribute to a cause you're passionate about
Travel and expense reimbursement because we've got your journey covered
Pension and disability insurance, securing your financial well-being in the long run
A hybrid way of working
A work from anywhere policy after your first year;
Working in a company that welcomes artificial intelligence and uses it to improve internal processes and push AI-powered features quickly
No non-technical managers! Have a manager who gets it, who inspires and leads the way as a champion for engineering excellence
MacBook Pro


Ready to take the next step in your career and join a team that's as vibrant as it is supportive? We can't wait to have you on board!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
REQUIREMENTS




Over 3 years of work experience in similar position
Bachelor's degree in business administration, economics or engineering.
Excellent spoken and written English.
Strong analytical skills, ability to discover requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches while working with unstructured datasets.
Ability to handle multiple projects areas with changing priorities and meet challenging deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Good understanding of data warehousing, data modeling, database design, business intelligence and their processes
Hands on knowledge about financial systems would be a plus
Experience with, database and reporting tools (SQL and Power BI)
Experience in working with Agile methodology is an advantage
Experience in BPMS and Modeling Workflow automation projects is an advantage




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES




Acts as a SPOC for internal and external parties involved in the project in different stages of the software development process, such as presales presentations, gathering requirements, solution design, functional and user acceptance testing.
Assesses the current state of the business and IT landscape to identify gaps, transition and integration requirements, recommends improvements and define the acceptance criteria.
Focus on implementing analytical requirements.
Communicate with precision: Crafts high quality and detailed diagrams, reports and presentations as needed.
Collaborate with data modelers, architects, developers and source system analysts to define source system output files structure, ensuring the quality of the data and considering non functional requirements (security, performance, availability or scalability
Create requirements mappings for the business terms defined by the business stakeholders and source to target mappings for the logical & physical model defined by the data modelers.
Elaborates features and transform them into stories for the implementation backlog in order to enable the team to implement solutions that will meet the business stakeholders’ needs
Work closely with developers, testers, product owner, delivery manager, in order to ensure the team keeps the product vision and priorities in mind.
Participate in handover, end user training and deployment activities.
Provides consulting and technical support to the end users
Ensure that workflow and internal (IT) procedures are applied within the business process and it is compliance with external and internal regulations and procedures
Show more

  • Bachelor's degree in business administration, economics or engineering.

  • Strong analytical skills, ability to discover requirements underlying feature requests, recommend alternative technical and business approaches while working with unstructured datasets.
  • Ability to handle multiple projects areas with changing priorities and meet challenging deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Good understanding of data warehousing, data modeling, database design, business intelligence and their processes
  • Hands on knowledge about financial systems would be a plus
  • Experience with, database and reporting tools (SQL and Power BI)
  • Experience in working with Agile methodology is an advantage
  • Experience in BPMS and Modeling Workflow automation projects is an advantage

  • Assesses the current state of the business and IT landscape to identify gaps, transition and integration requirements, recommends improvements and define the acceptance criteria.
  • Focus on implementing analytical requirements.

  • Create requirements mappings for the business terms defined by the business stakeholders and source to target mappings for the logical & physical model defined by the data modelers.

  • Provides consulting and technical support to the end users
  • Ensure that workflow and internal (IT) procedures are applied within the business process and it is compliance with external and internal regulations and procedures

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Adecco Italia Spa, ricerca per azienda operante nel settore della produzione di energia elettrica da fonte rinnovabile e tradizionale, una risorsa da inserire nell'ambito dell’Energy Management.




Ruolo: Data Analyst Junior




Descrizione delle attività:

Analisi, raccoglimento e interpretazione dati;
Stretta collaborazione con responsabili dei diversi dipartimenti aziendali;
Elaborazione report dettagliati con i risultati delle osservazioni effettuate;
Individuazione soluzioni concrete a partire dai risultati delle analisi.




Requisiti:

Conoscenza linguaggio di programmazione R e gestionale Python;
Ottima conoscenza di Excel;
Eccellenti doti di analisi anche di documenti regolatori e normativi complessi e di sintesi;
Titolo preferenziale la conoscenza dei mercati energetici (gas e elettrico).







Completano il profilo:

Problem solving

Capacità di gestione dello stress




Sede di lavoro: Civitavecchia

Modalità di lavoro: in sede, si prevedono due turni.

Tipologia contratto: inserimento diretto in azienda, retribuzione da definire coerentemente con le competenze della persona.




I candidati, nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006, D.lgs 215/2003 e D.lgs 216/2003, sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy consultabile sotto il form di richiesta dati della pagina di candidatura (Regolamento UE n. 2016/679).




ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa sulla pagina dedicata al phishing su adecco.it.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Intale is a VC backed retail-tech company that consists of gifted people that are not afraid to get their hands dirty.

Here we give superhero powers to small local retail stores, transforming them into a state-of-the-art, cutting-edge business. We have vowed to remove the slack and the fragmentation from offline retail. We achieve that through our platform that connects stores, distributors and retail manufacturers, creating a unique transparent marketplace.

Do you love helping businesses make data-driven decisions? Do you have a passion for analyzing data and finding trends?

Our team is expanding and we are looking to add a passionate Junior Data Analyst who who get his/her hands dirty with raw data, package it in meaningful ways and work with our key clients to deliver value adding actionable insights.

Your role will be to:


Develop a deep understanding our core data, structures and insight possibilities
Design categories and subcategories to slice and dice the data in meaningful ways
Ensure that the quality of the data is of the standards promised to our clients
Introduce the new products into our Universal Product database and set up the relevant processes and workflows
Extract the data and analyze it using a standard business intelligence tool



Requirements

You should have a genuine passion for data and data-driven decision making. Additionally:


Strong verbal and written communication skills (Greek/English)
Degree in statistics, math and/or computer science
Very good knowledge of MS SQL and/or MySQL
Very good knowledge of MS Excel
Experience in the use of business intelligence tools (e.g. Tableau) will be considered a plus
Expertise in Retail and/or FMCG Industry will be considered a plus
Flexibility in approach and innovative thinker



Benefits

Our people mean the world to us, and we only recruit the best. For the talents in our business, we offer great benefits and opportunities to develop with us.


Competitive package
Private health insurance plan
Training and advancement opportunities


Think you fit the bill? Tick the boxes, we need to talk.
Show more

Title: DATA ANALYST
Description:
📢 🔎 Desde ACCOM, empresa de Marketing Digital orientada en ventas, buscamos nuevo/a compi como Data Analyst con manejo de POWER BI y conocimiento en PYTHON, para que se incorpore a nuestro Equipo de Data & BI!




💡 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Dominio en manejo de herramientas de visualización (PowerBI).
Conocimientos en SQL avanzado, desarrollo, gestión y rendimiento.
Experiencia en infraestructura de Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Conocimiento en Python.
Habilidades en analítica de datos orientado a resultados de negocio.
Grado en Estadística, Física, Matemáticas, Economía, Ingeniería Informática o similares.




📝 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los equipos de negocio para comprender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en requisitos técnicos y visualizaciones efectivas.
Diseñar, crear y mantener flujos, informes y paneles de Power BI
Proporcionar soporte y capacitación en el uso de Power BI a los usuarios, ayudándoles a aprovechar al máximo la herramienta.
Analizar y optimizar el rendimiento de consultas SQL.
Trabajar en mapeo de datos, flujo de datos y linaje de datos.
Realizar análisis y evaluaciones de datos para identificar áreas de mejora, oportunidades de crecimiento y eficiencias operativas.




📌 ¿Qué ofrecemos?




Accom es una empresa de carácter joven y competitivo en constante crecimiento. Cuidamos mucho nuestra política de Talento y Cultura, buscando siempre la máxima vinculación de las personas con la empresa. Simplemente tratamos a las personas como nos gustaría que nos tratasen.




📈 Participación en la toma de decisiones.
📅 Flexibilidad horaria.
💻 Posibilidad de teletrabajo en formato híbrido.
💳 Retribución flexible (seguro médico privado, restaurante, transporte y guardería).
📚 Plan formativo acorde a tus necesidades.
💼 Cursos de idiomas ajustados a tu nivel.
🍰 El día de tu cumpleaños libre.
🤼 Eventos y actividades internas para hacer team building.
🏋🏻‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios.
📍 Ubicaciones céntricas en Madrid (Callao).




¡Si crees que eres el perfil que buscamos, estaremos encantados de conocerte!

Title: Data analyst Power BI - Débutant H/F
Description:
Profil du candidat

Vous avez récemment été diplômé(e) d'un Bac + 5 ?

Au cours de votre parcours, vous avez acquis des connaissances et compétences dans les domaines de la finance et du commerce ?

Débutez votre carrière par une expérience stimulante au cœur d’équipes internationales, engagées dans la transition énergétique !

Nous recherchons pour une durée de 12 mois sur notre site Coupole (92), un.e Data analyst Power BI - Débutant H/F

Les compétences attendues sont les suivantes :

Compétences techniques :


Power Bi, SAP, Esbase
Connaissances en contrôle de gestion



Savoir être indispensables :


Rigueur
Méthode
Capacité d'analyse
Curieux



Nous vous proposons un contrat de professionnalisation temps plein qualifiant de 12 mois incluant 15% de formation interne (métier, linguistique, outils…). Ces formations sont dispensées en interne par des organismes sélectionnés par TotalEnergies.

Ce contrat vous permettra d’acquérir une année d’expérience professionnelle tout en étant formé aux spécificités de votre métier en lien avec les activités de la Compagnie.

Pour postuler à cette offre, vous devez impérativement posséder, à la date d’embauche, un titre de séjour valide pour la période couverte par cette offre (minimum 13 mois). Attention, la conclusion de ce contrat de professionnalisation ne permet pas la délivrance d’un titre de séjour (article R.52221-6 du Code du travail).

Ce poste ne s'adresse pas aux personnes recherchant une alternance avec une école ou une formation diplômante, mais aux personnes récemment diplômées à la recherche d'une première expérience.

Un réel atout pour booster votre employabilité !

Activités

En tant que Data analyst Power BI - Débutant H/F, vos missions seront les suivantes :


Fiabiliser/stabiliser certains rapports Power Bi existants
Comprendre les besoins du contrôle de gestion et des opérationnels en matière de reporting financier et proposer des améliorations.
Créer des tableaux de bord interactifs pour présenter les résultats de manière graphique et concises aux opérationnels.
Préconiser des solutions techniques adaptées , concevoir et développer des solutions Power BI
Accompagner les clients dans l'acculturation de Power BI
Former les utilisateurs sur les nouveaux outils de reporting sur Power BI
Gérer la documentation technique, documenter la modélisation et le fonctionnement des rapports



Si cette offre vous intéresse alors n'attendez plus... Postulez chez TotalEnergies !

Contexte et environnement

Fonction au sein de la direction Contrôle de Gestion Siège de la Direction Finance - Economie - Réserves pétrolières de la branche Exploration Production.

Vous évoluerez au sein d'une équipe de 12 personnes dans le service Cost Control Siège:


Effectifs gérés: 530- Dépenses : 344 M€ - Refacturation aux filiales: 126 M€



Contexte international important, toutes les filiales sont à l'étranger et de nombreux collègues ou contacts sont étrangers
Show more
HTML:
Profil du candidat

Vous avez récemment été diplômé(e) d'un Bac + 5 ?

Au cours de votre parcours, vous avez acquis des connaissances et compétences dans les domaines de la finance et du commerce ?

Débutez votre carrière par une expérience stimulante au cœur d’équipes internationales, engagées dans la transition énergétique !

Nous recherchons pour une durée de 12 mois sur notre site Coupole (92), un.e Data analyst Power BI - Débutant H/F

Les compétences attendues sont les suivantes :

Compétences techniques :

  • Power Bi, SAP, Esbase
  • Connaissances en contrôle de gestion


Savoir être indispensables :

  • Rigueur
  • Méthode
  • Capacité d'analyse
  • Curieux


Nous vous proposons un contrat de professionnalisation temps plein qualifiant de 12 mois incluant 15% de formation interne (métier, linguistique, outils…). Ces formations sont dispensées en interne par des organismes sélectionnés par TotalEnergies.

Ce contrat vous permettra d’acquérir une année d’expérience professionnelle tout en étant formé aux spécificités de votre métier en lien avec les activités de la Compagnie.

Pour postuler à cette offre, vous devez impérativement posséder, à la date d’embauche, un titre de séjour valide pour la période couverte par cette offre (minimum 13 mois). Attention, la conclusion de ce contrat de professionnalisation ne permet pas la délivrance d’un titre de séjour (article R.52221-6 du Code du travail).

Ce poste ne s'adresse pas aux personnes recherchant une alternance avec une école ou une formation diplômante, mais aux personnes récemment diplômées à la recherche d'une première expérience.

Un réel atout pour booster votre employabilité !

 Activités

En tant que Data analyst Power BI - Débutant H/F, vos missions seront les suivantes :

  • Fiabiliser/stabiliser certains rapports Power Bi existants
  • Comprendre les besoins du contrôle de gestion et des opérationnels en matière de reporting financier et proposer des améliorations.
  • Créer des tableaux de bord interactifs pour présenter les résultats de manière graphique et concises aux opérationnels.
  • Préconiser des solutions techniques adaptées , concevoir et développer des solutions Power BI
  • Accompagner les clients dans l'acculturation de Power BI
  • Former les utilisateurs sur les nouveaux outils de reporting sur Power BI
  • Gérer la documentation technique, documenter la modélisation et le fonctionnement des rapports


Si cette offre vous intéresse alors n'attendez plus... Postulez chez TotalEnergies !

Contexte et environnement

Fonction au sein de la direction Contrôle de Gestion Siège de la Direction Finance - Economie - Réserves pétrolières de la branche Exploration Production.

Vous évoluerez au sein d'une équipe de 12 personnes dans le service Cost Control Siège:

  • Effectifs gérés: 530- Dépenses : 344 M€ - Refacturation aux filiales: 126 M€


Contexte international important, toutes les filiales sont à l'étranger et de nombreux collègues ou contacts sont étrangers

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For over a decade, the Bosch Cluj Plant has become a strategic hub for innovation and production, making a significant impact on the technological landscape in Romania. Through our constant commitment to excellence in quality and innovation, we develop a diverse range of modern products for the mobility industry, focusing on delivering cutting-edge solutions to our international customers. Inspired by passion for technology, we have consistently evolved, solidifying our position as the most desired employer in Cluj for the engineering and business candidates. We pay special attention to the development of our community, inspiring future generations and governing our impact on the environment.

Our promise to our colleagues is rock-solid: we grow together, we enjoy our work, and inspire each other. Join us and see the difference. Work



Job Description



Are you driven to unlock the power of data and translate it into strategic insights? Are you passionate about digital transformation? Our cutting-edge manufacturing plant is searching for a data whiz to join our team! As we embrace Industry 4.0 and become a data-driven powerhouse, you'll play a key role in crafting informative reports and dashboards using Tableau and PowerBI. We need someone who will understand our business inside and out, and can design and implement BI solutions that fuel smart decision-making. You'll be a data maestro, wrangling information from various sources like our ERP (SAP), MES, and data warehouse to paint a clear picture through KPIs.

Key Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable and insightful BI reports and dashboards using Tableau, PowerBI, and other relevant BI tools.
Work closely with cross-functional teams to gather and define data requirements that align with business goals, ensuring accurate representation of data in BI reports.
Understand and analyze data from our ERP (SAP), MES, and various local solutions, integrating them effectively to provide comprehensive insights.
Continuously enhance data collection methods to improve efficiency and accuracy, supporting the creation of a robust data warehouse for KPI reporting.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets, providing actionable insights to stakeholders.
Leverage low code / no code technologies to streamline data analytics processes and develop rapid prototypes of data solutions.
Implement low code / no code applications to enhance the flexibility and responsiveness of BI solutions to changing business needs.
Facilitate training and support for users of BI tools across the organization, fostering a data-driven culture.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Data Analytics, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or Business Intelligence Analyst, with extensive experience in designing and implementing BI solutions.
Expertise in BI tools such as Tableau and PowerBI is essential.
Strong understanding of ERP systems, preferably SAP, MES, and data warehouse technologies.
Proficient in SQL and experience in querying databases, data manipulation, and analysis.
Familiarity with low code / no code platforms and their application in data analytics projects.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong communication skills, capable of conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively in a team environment as well as independently.
Proactive, curious, and innovative, with a strong problem-solving aptitude.


Additional Information



Bosch Benefits

25 days of annual leave – because your work-life balance is essential to us
Annual performance bonus up to two salaries – we appreciate your contribution to the company’s success
Annual salary review – we want you to feel fairly compensated for your hard work and dedication
Gift tickets worth 300 RON for Christmas and Easter
Flexible benefits – you will benefit from a monthly benefit budget that offers the possibility to customize the benefits package to suit your individual needs and preferences (You can opt for meal tickets worth 30 RON for every worked day or you can benefit from cultural tickets, gift tickets, or vacation vouchers, and discounts at restaurants, dentistry, shops, and many more)
Referral bonus - we encourage you to refer new candidates and you will be rewarded for it
Relocation package – we are committed to providing a supportive and inclusive work environment, so if you are recruited from another county, you will receive a special relocation bonus for 2 years which will help you to get settled in Cluj
Lunch discount – we have two canteens within our plant where you can eat your lunch at subsidized price
Flexible working hours – so that you can balance you work and personal obligations more effectively
Ability to work from the satellite Bosch location in Cluj-Napoca when it’s more convenient for you to do so
Home Office policy – you will benefit from a hybrid working model which takes into consideration the needs of each department in the plant and offers you the possibility to work from home when it is practical and convenient for you
Private medical insurance because health is a priority to us
Development Trainings - we have our own team of dedicated trainers that are providing specific trainings for personal and professional growth. In addition to this, we provide local development programs for Project Managers, Line Managers and Experts, external trainings, and assignments opportunities
Language courses – if your role demands it, you will have the chance to enhance your language skill set internally
Inspiring working conditions – we are committed to providing our employees a positive and fulfilling work experience
Transportation - to and from the Bosch Cluj Plant
Show more

  • Private medical insurance because health is a priority to us
  • Development Trainings - we have our own team of dedicated trainers that are providing specific trainings for personal and professional growth. In addition to this, we provide local development programs for Project Managers, Line Managers and Experts, external trainings, and assignments opportunities

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
A little about us...

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world.

· We provide our employees with a learning environment that promotes growth and creativity.

· To learn more please visit us at https://www.ltimindtree.com/Twitter @ https://twitter.com/ltimindtre




We are looking for Data Analyst with below expertise:




Work as an IT analyst Designer , Data Modeler and Data Analyst
Minimum 10 years of experience
Strong in SQL
Understanding business requirements and converting them to IT requirements
Participating conducting meetings with business BA or framework SME to capture requirements
Performing data and object level analysis for identifying IT solution More
Ability to write SQL Queries back track data
Description of knowledge and experience
Previous experience of banking and financial regulatory framework data models would be a huge plus
Experience of data analysis and modelling
Hands on experience of advanced SQL for query execution
Experience of Scrum Agile methodologies
Ability to understand data warehouse architecture
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical design for development
Ability to understand data models from both business and technical perspective Logic Physical Symantec Layer
Ability to understand technology and technical perspectives RDMS Teradata Snowflake
Understanding of regulatory frameworks such as FINREP COREP etc
Experience and knowledge of financial regulatory reporting and data attributes
Ability to communicate effectively with both business stakeholders and IT experts
Supporting testers in root cause analysis of incidents

Title: Data Analyst to H&M – Supply Planning
Description:
Company Description

H&M is a workplace where you’ll join a global fashion family that combines teamwork with individual expression and gives you the challenges and opportunities that can help you learn, grow, and succeed. We believe that it’s when you mix and match different talents, experiences, and styles that the real magic happens. That’s why our teams are built with different personalities, talents and people from all kinds of backgrounds. If you are willing to learn, grow and help our customers and your colleagues, H&M will always be a place for you to both express your individuality and feel like you belong. We also believe that you can’t change the world without great people on your side. So, we offer all our employee’s generous benefits, lots of learning opportunities and the possibility to start building a more long-term career. Bring your whole personality to work, stay as long as you want, and grow more than you ever thought was possible. Be yourself & more at H&M.

The advertised role is the unit of Supply Planning which is part of the Supply Chain function. The mission of the Supply Planning unit is to enable Region and Business units to maximize the value of availability, lead-time, cost, and inventory in a sustainable way. We do this by leading the development, implementation and follow up of supply planning strategies, processes, and technology. 

Job Description

Are you interested working with data analytics in the field of supply planning in the ever-evolving fashion retail and e-commerce industry? This is a unique opportunity to nurture your analytical side working with big data to provide insights that will lead our area in their decision making. We want to release the power of people and believe the best ideas evolve when great minds with different perspectives meet. We believe in our people, and always encourage new ideas and initiatives.

The role

We are recruiting for two data analyst vacancies, one in the in-season stock management field and one in the end-to-end enablers field of our Supply Planning Unit. In both roles you will work as a key enabler to secure realization of business and customer value from analytics, data and modelling of our supply planning capabilities and logics within our logistical network. You have a strong supply chain focus, a commercial mindset and innate curiosity, you keep the customer at heart, and you love making data talk! At H&M Supply Planning you will get the opportunity to work in a large data analyst community and in an organization, which heavily relies on making data driven decisions. We have over 1 billion customers with 130 million members in 70 different markets along with 8 unique brands in a fast-paced retail industry.

Some of your main responsibilities & tasks will include:


Be the driver for data driven decision making in your initiative/product team by taking data into insights and provide the team with clear, data driven recommendations.
Apply advanced analytics and tools to model, execute and follow up initiatives from idea to industrialization.
Use SQL and potentially further programming languages to gather, clean and prepare data for analysis.
Define and set up measurable KPI’s and OKRs, own and maintain their visualization for value reporting.
Be the go-to person in your product team/initiative for data and analytics knowledge.
Work as a part of an agile organization to support product development and support building business cases to showcase the value of new undertakings.
Participate in the wider analytics community, both within Supply Planning and the wider H&M group!



Qualifications

Just like everyone at H&M, we believe you are a business-minded, open, communicative, and ambitious team player full of drive and optimism. You have a robust analytical ability with an eye for change and improvement opportunities.


Academic degree within Economics, Business, Supply Chain, Mathematics, Engineering, or similar
Previous experience within supply chain, retail, fashion, or tech product driven companies preferred.
Profound work experience in the field of analytics related to product/business development.
Ability to define, align and confidently lead analytical assignments with the strategic goals of the business.
Confidently working with analytical programming languages such as SQL, Python, or R
Experience in working with data visualization tools e.g., Power BI, Looker
Understanding of using numerical, statistical, and analytical methods to apply to data processing.
Demonstrated ability to analyze large amounts of data into clear insights.
Ability to work with multiple stakeholders across different competences (Product Mgrs., Software Engineers, etc.)
Strong communication and storytelling skills and ability to communicate and explain data and its implications to various stakeholders .
Be comfortable with working within a large matrix organization.
Analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills.
Experience and/or interest in technical product development.



Additional Information

This is a full time position based in Stockholm. If you believe you will bring value to this role and want to join our fantastic team, please upload your CV (in English) as soon as possible. Responsible recruiter is Sarah Assem. We look forward to receiving your application!

H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability or age.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Customer Experience Data Analyst - 6 Month Contract - Dublin




Your new company




This company is a reputable organisation within the public sector based in Dublin.




Your new role




Work to continuously improve customer journeys, thus realising better Customer Experience resulting in improved Customer Satisfaction scores.
Support the management of the Customer Experience programme to monitor and analyse customer satisfaction through available escalation/complaint tools and survey results, identify operational improvement opportunities, create business case recommendations and implement approved changes proactively and regularly.
Work with other functions to raise quality standards across the process and improve the quality and turnaround times of customer issues.
Participate in rollout of new/refined processes and training material.
Support the delivery of CRU and other regulatory requirements in relation to analysis of bespoke CRU survey.
Support the customer experience strategy and programme and continuous improvement programme.
Collation of the data analysis across the various reporting and customer experience data set to deliver meaningful insights that can be used to proactively manage the customer experience.
Collaboration with key internal stakeholders across the business.
Drive service improvements through root cause analysis utilising all available data.
Support the delivery of continuous improvement initiatives and promote a culture of process improvement.










What you'll need to succeed




5+ years experience as a Data Analyst working with customer data which includes experience with "sentiment analysis" and more.
Relevant third level qualification and or accreditation is desirable and or relevant experience.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to convey messages in a clear and concise manner.
Strong Computer skills with a proficient working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.




What you'll get in return




Pay rate between €45K- 55K per annum - pro rata (Dependent on experience).
Opportunity to work with a reputable organisation within the public sector who impact the lives of homeowners and businesses across Ireland.
Hybrid work model.




Eligibility




Currently living in Ireland.
Flexible to work in a hybrid setting in Dublin.
Currently holding an EEA passport or valid Stamp 4 visa. (Visa must be for duration of contract).
Immediate starter (if possible).

Title: Data Analyst H/F
Description:
Description de la mission

Rattaché au département Strategy & Insights, vous contribuez à l’élaboration de la stratégie de l’entreprise grâce à vos compétences d’analyse de données. En charge de l’analyse du business, vous donnez du sens à ces données pour en extraire de la valeur et aider les décisionnaires à prendre des décisions stratégiques ou opérationnelles.

Vous agissez en tant que Business Partner et savez adapter vos analyses aux problématiques de vos interlocuteurs pour vous assurer, ensemble, de construire des recommandations qui répondent aux enjeux de l’entreprise.

Vos Missions

Analyse de la performance business


Analyser la performance business (transactions, ventes…) selon différents niveaux de granularité (dayparts, zones géographiques, typologies de bâtiments…) et au prisme des différents leviers stratégiques et de contexte
Rédiger des recommandations stratégiques à destination du comité exécutif & des équipes internes


Pilotage de la performance


Accompagner les équipes métiers dans l’analyse de la performance (campagnes, enjeux opérationnels, canaux) : insights, analyses et outils d’aide à la décision en amont et en aval des projets
Traiter les demandes ou analyses Ad hoc suivant l’actualité de l’Enseigne et les différentes demandes (Marketing / Achats / Opérations/Région/Franchisés/DSI)


Gestion de la donnée


Manipuler une base de données conséquente et en extraire une donnée intelligible et pertinente pour répondre aux enjeux de l’entreprise
Monitorer la qualité de la donnée, en étroite collaboration avec la DSI en France et aux Etats-Unis
Être force de proposition sur les solutions de gestion de la donnée et récolter les besoins du département pour adapter la solution aux problématiques de l’équipe


Pour réaliser vos missions, vous travaillerez en collaboration transversale avec différents départements de l’entreprise comme la DSI, le marketing, les opérations, les achats, les franchisés…

Cette liste est non exhaustive et les missions peuvent être amenées à évoluer.

Profil

Niveau d’études : Formation Bac+5 type école d’ingénieur ou école de commerce / spécialisation dans l’analyse de données (type master)

Expérience : 4-5 ans d’expérience au service de la stratégie de l’entreprise. Que ce soit en tant que consultant ou au sein de l’entreprise, vous avez travaillé à la construction de la stratégie de l’entreprise à la fois grâce à vos compétences de gestion de la donnée et à vos compétences analytiques
Show more
HTML:
Description de la mission

Rattaché au département Strategy & Insights, vous contribuez à l’élaboration de la stratégie de l’entreprise grâce à vos compétences d’analyse de données. En charge de l’analyse du business, vous donnez du sens à ces données pour en extraire de la valeur et aider les décisionnaires à prendre des décisions stratégiques ou opérationnelles.

Vous agissez en tant que Business Partner et savez adapter vos analyses aux problématiques de vos interlocuteurs pour vous assurer, ensemble, de construire des recommandations qui répondent aux enjeux de l’entreprise.

Vos Missions

Analyse de la performance business

  • Analyser la performance business (transactions, ventes…) selon différents niveaux de granularité (dayparts, zones géographiques, typologies de bâtiments…) et au prisme des différents leviers stratégiques et de contexte
  • Rédiger des recommandations stratégiques à destination du comité exécutif & des équipes internes

Pilotage de la performance

  • Accompagner les équipes métiers dans l’analyse de la performance (campagnes, enjeux opérationnels, canaux) : insights, analyses et outils d’aide à la décision en amont et en aval des projets
  • Traiter les demandes ou analyses Ad hoc suivant l’actualité de l’Enseigne et les différentes demandes (Marketing / Achats / Opérations/Région/Franchisés/DSI)

Gestion de la donnée

  • Manipuler une base de données conséquente et en extraire une donnée intelligible et pertinente pour répondre aux enjeux de l’entreprise
  • Monitorer la qualité de la donnée, en étroite collaboration avec la DSI en France et aux Etats-Unis
  • Être force de proposition sur les solutions de gestion de la donnée et récolter les besoins du département pour adapter la solution aux problématiques de l’équipe

Pour réaliser vos missions, vous travaillerez en collaboration transversale avec différents départements de l’entreprise comme la DSI, le marketing, les opérations, les achats, les franchisés…

Cette liste est non exhaustive et les missions peuvent être amenées à évoluer.

Profil

Niveau d’études : Formation Bac+5 type école d’ingénieur ou école de commerce / spécialisation dans l’analyse de données (type master)

Expérience : 4-5 ans d’expérience au service de la stratégie de l’entreprise. Que ce soit en tant que consultant ou au sein de l’entreprise, vous avez travaillé à la construction de la stratégie de l’entreprise à la fois grâce à vos compétences de gestion de la donnée et à vos compétences analytiques

Title: Junior Data Production Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for an enthusiastic entry-level Junior Data Production Analyst to join our Verticals Reporting team. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Our Kantar Worldpanel’s Verticals Reporting Team is dedicated to creating comprehensive databases across various market sectors and countries. Our Verticals Data Production Analysts are skilled professionals who excel in building, validating, and analyzing trends, always with a focus on meeting the diverse needs of our stakeholders. Additionally, they collaborate closely with global markets to ensure alignment and accuracy.

As a Junior Data Production Analyst, you will receive training in data extraction, loading, processing, and transformation. Your responsibilities will include performing quality control, data validation, and database management, as well as producing and delivering databases that meet stakeholder requirements and transform them into actionable reporting deliverables.

If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Build, validate, and analyse data trends, with a strong focus on stakeholder needs.
Collaborate effectively with global markets.
Extract data using various platforms and tools.
Produce and deliver databases as agreed upon with our UK partner.
Process and validate generated data.
Ensure quality assurance for all deliverables.
Provide analysis and support in data processing, leveraging business software.
Translate stakeholder requirements into production-ready deliverables.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


Knowledge or previous experience in data manipulation is appreciated.
Be able to write, read, comprehend, reason, and perform basic mathematic calculations and data analysis.
English professional proficiency – minimum B2 Level is required.


With the following qualities…


Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


The following, although not mandatory, will be appreciated…


Experience or knowledge in data management, including tools like MS Access, SQL, and object-oriented programming languages.
Knowledge or previous experience with MS Excel (e.g. Advanced Formulas; Pivot Tables) is recommended.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical reasoning assessment test.
2nd Stage – Screening interview with Talent Acquisition.
3rd Stage – Panel meeting with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.
Show more

Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Multinacional)
Description:
En VISEO nos diferenciamos por la participación en proyectos innovadores de soluciones Cloud, usando tecnologías Microsoft, líderes en el mercado y donde actualmente somos Partners y aportamos más de 490 certificaciones.

Esta es una gran oportunidad para formar parte de una multinacional presente en los 5 continentes como Data Visualization Analyst.

Tu Rol:


Generación de visualización e interpretación de datos (diseño de sistemas, tableros, gráficos de información, mapeo, herramientas de datos) dando sentido al flujo de análisis y storytelling que ayude a las áreas de negocio.
Liderar junto con el Product Owner las relaciones con los equipos de negocio (comerciales y/o de operaciones), para asegurar un pleno entendimiento del área.
Apoyar a su equipo en la resolución de problemas y desafíos relacionados con reportería y análisis de la información.


Tu perfil:


Profesional con 3 años de experiencia laboral previa como analista de datos utilizando herramientas de visualización como Tableau, Power BI o similares.
Formación superior en negocios, matemáticas, económicas, finanzas, estadística o ingeniería.
Se valora experiencia en sector aéreo, turismo y viajes.
Buena capacidad de comunicación e influencia para interactuar con distintas areas de negocio.
Orientación a resultados, trabajo colaborativo y en equipo.
Experiencia y solvencia con lenguajes de consulta de datos (p. ej., SQL).
Valorable nivel de inglés alto.


Tendrás las siguientes responsabilidades en seguridad dentro de la compañía:


Acceso a la información confidencial relativa al cliente del que es responsable.
Solicitud de medidas / usuarios.
Observancia del cumplimiento de las políticas de seguridad y las políticas internas.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist Júnior en Modelos de Innovación de Riesgos
Description:
Somos Banco Sabadell




Más de 14.000 personas que trabajamos en equipo compartiendo nuestro esfuerzo para alcanzar una meta. Nos caracterizamos por nuestra implicación, espíritu de colaboración y dinamismo. Somos una entidad que en su larga y exitosa trayectoria ha sabido combinar la tradición en la forma de hacer banca, la visión a largo plazo, el crecimiento y la innovación. Una marca fuerte y reconocida en el entorno, para más de 11 millones de clientes que valoran la calidad de nuestros productos y nuestra apuesta por gestionar “su experiencia” como cliente.

Nuestra razón de ser es ayudar a personas y empresas a hacer realidad sus proyectos, anticipándonos y ocupándonos de que tomen las mejores decisiones económicas, a través de nuestros valores: el compromiso, no conformismo, profesionalidad, eficacia, empatía y franqueza.

Y además, lo hacemos mediante una gestión responsable y comprometida con el medio ambiente.

¡Únete a nosotros!




¿Qué estamos buscando?




Actualmente buscamos un perfil proactivo, con visión de negocio y habilidades interpersonales que se integre en un equipo que analiza la adecuación de diversos modelos de riesgo crediticio asociados al segmento de negocio de Banca Particulares de Banco Sabadell.




Hablemos del proyecto...




Tu misión se centrará en dar soporte a la medición y anticipación del comportamiento del cliente, mediante el desarrollo de metodologías analíticas avanzadas, que ayuden a predecir y entender cómo es, qué hace, cómo será y qué hará el cliente, repercutiendo en acciones que simplifiquen los procesos de admisión, seguimiento y recuperación, incrementando su eficiencia – eficacia y ayudando a generar el margen incremental creciente de Sabadell España.




Entre tus responsabilidades principales se encontrarán:




Colaborarás en el desarrollo de modelos enfocados a potenciar la creación de negocio mediante metodologías analíticas y de Machine Learning.
Desarrollarás hipótesis que permitan diseñar y probar experimentos analíticos, con el objetivo de identificar áreas de oportunidad y medir el impacto potencial de nuevas iniciativas.
Elaborarás la documentación de modelos requerida para su presentación a comités.
Participarás en diversos proyectos de la Dirección que afecten a los modelos tanto para la creación de negocio como para anticipar el comportamiento de los clientes.
Revisarás y mejorarás los modelos actuales en función de las directrices de cumplimento normativo interno y externo exigido por los reguladores.




¿Qué valoramos de tu candidatura?




Que tengas estudios superiores en ámbito Técnico (Matemáticas, Estadística, Ingeniería, Física o similar) empresarial (ADE, Economía o similar).
Master o Postgrado en Finanzas Cuantitativas o similar.
Experiencia mínima de 1-2 años en creación y mantenimiento de modelos de riesgo crediticio en sector Banca.
Que estés habituado y/o aportes experiencia en gestión de información, análisis de BBDD y elaboración de informes.
Valoraremos experiencia en creación de modelos estadísticos con diferentes metodologías.
Que conozcas lenguajes de programación estadística (SAS-SQL, R, Phyton), así como dominio del paquete Office.
Valoraremos que aportes un correcto nivel de Inglés (sobre todo a nivel de comprensión).




Banco Sabadell está comprometido en promover ambientes de trabajo en los que se trate con respeto y dignidad a las personas, procurando el desarrollo profesional de la plantilla y garantizando la igualdad de oportunidades en su selección, formación y promoción ofreciendo un entorno de trabajo libre de cualquier discriminación por motivo de género, edad, orientación sexual, religión, etnia o cualquier otra circunstancia personal o social.

Banco Sabadell forma parte de la red de empresas con el distintivo de “Igualdad en la Empresa” otorgado por el Ministerio de Igualdad.




Queda totalmente prohibida la reproducción total o parcial de cualquiera de sus apartados en cualquier soporte sin el consentimiento por escrito del Grupo Banco Sabadell.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Description:
Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights.
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations.
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings.
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments.
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued.
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous.
Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


Your Contribution:


Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes.
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights.
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making.
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges.
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis.
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations.


Benefits

Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!


Show more

As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a global European HQ'd biotech that has grown 90% in the past two years and has seen huge success with recent launches - their stocks/shares have absolutely rocketed as a result.




They are looking for a Subject Matter Expert (Data Analytics) to join their Business Information Systems team. Within this role you will be working in close collaboration with Quality and Regulatory teams, understanding, anticipating and influencing the demand for services and translating requirements into efficient and harmonised solutions. You would be working with Snowflake, Veeva and Matilion so need strong experience with these tools/systems.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Senior Internal Audit Data Analyst - Dublin

Apollo Solutions is currently searching for a Senior Data Analyst for our client, a multinational FMCG manufacturer and distributor. This role will be responsible for the development of the data Analytics capabilities of the companies Internal Audit team. You will get the chance to join a talented, enthusiastic team looking to continue to grow out their function.




Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain dashboards through the use of data visualisation tools
Create data models and workflows to aid in internal audit processes
Create systems to automate manual tasks
Communicate data insights and recommendations with stakeholders across the internal audit function




Requirements:

3+ years experience in a data focused role
Bachelor's degree in data analytics (or similar technical field)
Proven experience with data analytics tools such as Python, Alteryx, SQL, Snowflake, Excel etc.
Experience with data visualisation (Power BI, Tableau etc.)
Ability to travel internationally (20%)




If you are looking to be part of a growing team and take your career to the next level - Apply Now!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Desde Manpowergroup Talent Solutions, estamos buscando un Data Analyst para incorporar en cliente final.




Nuestro cliente es un grupo multinacional industrial, líder en el mercado en su actividad, con un negocio consolidado y rentable, que por otra parte se encuentra en un interesante momento de transformación.




Misión del puesto:

Dar soporte a los diferentes principales clientes internos de la compañía en el análisis y la gestión del dato. Análisis de la información a partir de los datos existentes y obtención de insights relevantes que apoyen, de forma activa, la toma de decisiones de negocio.




Funciones y responsabilidades clave:

Responsable de consolidación de BBDD.
Creación de informes y dashboards que faciliten el análisis del performance de la compañía por parte de los diferentes departamentos y managers a los que dará soporte para servir de apoyo en la toma de decisiones.
Generación de análisis y propuesta de acciones.
Obtención de insights relevantes a partir del estudio, interconexión y análisis de la información existente.
Participación en proyectos relacionados con Inteligencia Artificial (IA).
Análisis y evaluación de las propuestas que se realizan.




Competencias Clave: (se realizará prueba práctica durante el proceso)

Capacidad analítica avanzada.

Excel: avanzado.

Power BI: avanzado.

SQL: avanzado.

SAP: deseable.

Salesforce: deseable.

Python: deseable.

Google Analytics: deseable.




Idiomas:

Español.

Inglés: mínimo B2, deseable C1




Experiencia:

≥ 3 años de experiencia gestionando datos y reporting.
Experiencia en generación de dashboards o cuadros de mandos para apoyar la toma de decisiones de negocio.
Deseable experiencia en contacto directo con equipos comerciales.




Perfil:

Analíticamente avanzado.
Autonomía y proactividad.
Visión del análisis desde las necesidades del cliente y el negocio.
Facilidad para el manejo de diferentes clientes internos en jerarquías de la organización.
Orientación a resultados y a generación de negocio.
Capacidad emprendedora y creativa.
Excelentes capacidades en la resolución de problemas.




Ubicación:

Sevilla




Modalidad:

Teletrabajo híbrido




Si te apasiona el análisis de datos, cuentas con experiencia en la creación de dashboards que transforman información en decisiones clave, y buscas un entorno dinámico en el que puedas crecer y desarrollar tu carrera, ¡queremos conocerte! ¡Postúlate ahora y da el siguiente paso en tu carrera profesional!
